author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: ٍ إِلى بَحْرِ الغَنآءِ، وَجَمالِكَ يا سُلْطانَ القِدَمِ وَالمُسْتَوِيْ عَلَى العَرْشِ الأَعْظَمِ إِنَّ مَطْلَعَ آياتِكَ وَمَظْهَرَ شُئُوناتِكَ مَعَ بَحْرِ عِلْم
translation: This is the Day, O my Lord, whose brightness Thou hast exalted above the brightness of the sun and the splendors thereof. I testify that the light it sheddeth proceedeth out of the glory of the light of Thy countenance, and is begotten by the radiance of the morn of Thy Revelation. This is the Day whereon the hopeless have been clothed with the raiment of confidence, and the sick attired with the robe of healing, and the poor drawn nigh unto the ocean of Thy riches.
